summary: This FBI Guardian Complaint Form documents a report from an attorney representing the Virgin Islands Attorney General in a civil case against the Jeffrey Epstein estate. The attorney relayed accusations of violent rape against Jes Staley, CEO of Barclays Bank, from two women, and also alleged that Epstein's attorney and accountant were aware of and helped cover up his crimes.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the civil matter and the estate against which the Virgin Islands Attorney General is litigating. His criminal activities of child sex trafficking are referenced.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Accused by two women of violent rape. The accusations were relayed to the FBI by an outside counsel for the Virgin Islands Attorney General.

connections.description: Staley is accused of violent rape by women, with the accusations being reported in the context of an investigation into Epstein's estate, suggesting a potential association within the same social or criminal milieu.

events.title: FBI Complaint Filed Regarding Staley Accusations
events.description: An attorney for the Virgin Islands AG contacts the FBI to report accusations of violent rape against Jes Staley by two women and to allege that Epstein's attorney and accountant helped cover up crimes.

keyFacts: Two women have made accusations of violent rape against Jes Staley, the CEO of Barclays Bank.
One of the women believes she previously reported these accusations to the FBI.
An investigation into the Jeffrey Epstein estate uncovered information suggesting Epstein's attorney and accountant were aware of his activities and helped cover them up.
The report was filed via an FBI Guardian Complaint Form by an outside counsel for the Attorney General of the Virgin Islands.
The document explicitly links the accusations against Staley to the broader investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's criminal network.
